front.div:
The MT Explorer line is the culmination of nearly a decade's worth of research and engineering.
While assisting a customer with equipment for a government RFI, MassTech saw a need for a
commercial, high resolution mass spectrometer which would in order to provide quick and
accurate measurements in the field. The MT Explorer line gives you the capability to do in-situ
measurements and analysis without wasting time sending samples back to a full laboratory.
Both the MT Explorer 50 and 100 contain a 3-D ion trap capable of MS-MS and an Atmospheric
Interface (AP-I) allowing you to connect a variety of sources to them. Combined with a source
such as an AP MALDI, you have a setup capable of identifying biological contaminants on a
crop, or perhaps a specific polymer or hydrocarbon in mere minutes.
The MT Explorer 100 is our premier instrument -with resolution and range comparable to a
Thermo(c) LCQ, and at a cost the fraction of a typical table top mass spectrometer, the MTE
100 should be considered for your next purchase. The MT Explorer 50 is our newest device,
designed specifically for users concerned about space and weight. While maintaining similar
performance to the MTE 100, the MTE 50 cuts power requirements in half and squeezes the
unit footprint to the absolute minimum. Due to hit full production in 2013, the MTE 50 is
currently available in the US only.
